name: Tropical Paradise Smoothie
description: A refreshing smoothie with a blend of tropical fruits, perfect for a summer treat.
instructions: Add pineapple, mango, banana, coconut milk, and orange juice to a blender.
Blend until smooth, adding ice cubes for extra chill if desired.
If the smoothie is too thick, add a bit of water or more coconut milk to adjust the consistency.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
cookingNote: Freeze the fruits for a thicker texture and more refreshing smoothie.
author: Chef Maria

name: Berry Blast Smoothie
description: A sweet and tangy smoothie with mixed berries and yogurt.
instructions: Add the strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, Greek yogurt, and almond milk to a blender.
Blend until smooth, adding honey if you prefer more sweetness.
If the smoothie is too thick, add more almond milk to adjust the consistency.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
cookingNote: Using frozen berries gives a colder, thicker texture.
author: Chef Emily

name: Green Power Smoothie
description: A nutrient-packed smoothie with spinach, apple, and banana.
instructions: Add spinach, apple, banana, water, and almond milk to the blender.
Blend until smooth, adding chia seeds and blend again.
If the smoothie is too thick, add more water or almond milk to adjust the consistency.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
cookingNote: Add some lemon juice for a refreshing kick and extra vitamin C.
author: Chef Olivia

name: Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie
description: A creamy smoothie with peanut butter and banana for a rich, satisfying treat.
instructions: Place the banana, peanut butter, Greek yogurt, almond milk, and honey into the blender.
Blend until smooth, adding more almond milk if needed for a thinner consistency.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
cookingNote: For a richer flavor, use natural peanut butter without added sugars.
author: Chef Alex

name: Avocado Lime Smoothie
description: A creamy and tangy smoothie with avocado and lime, a perfect refreshing treat.
instructions: Add avocado, banana, coconut water, lime juice, and honey to the blender.
Blend until smooth, adding ice cubes if you prefer a colder smoothie.
Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
cookingNote: Add extra lime juice for a zesty kick.
author: Chef Sophia
